Summary: I have RVed for 15 years and until today have never had an issue dumping my black and gray water tanks.  The sewer dump port is located at an angle in the power station at your site.  When you put the hose fitting into it there is no way to insure that it sits tight in the opening so when I pulled the flange I had black water spewing all over the ground.  I have never had this issue before and consider it a health hazard, incredibly unsanitary.  Whether they tried to save money or were just lazy, I don’t know but the fitting as it is now is a disaster.  The sites are small, the place has become run down and shabby.  For what they charge I would expect more attention to detail and a fix to a dangerous health situation.  I have no issues with the location, I know that it is on the
Room tip: What ever you do, have two people dump, one to pull the flange, one to hold onto the sewer hose...

Summary: Went for a few hours to let the kids play at the water park; overcast but not crowded at 10 am. Lots of parking available. Less than 2 hours later, very crowded. Families set up easy ups to hang out all day. Our kids had a great time, will go back. Also able to get lunch-good burgers/pizza. Very convenient.

Newport dunes is as fun today as when i was a kid with my family.  Nice little beach area.  Good families having fun.  Ppl ride bikes.  Golf carts. Etc.  They have a general store.  You can rent fire pits.   They have duffy boats. A water park.  Stand up paddle boards.  Just great family fun.
Room tip: You can order golf carts in advance.  Very helpful

Summary: Used to be an awesome resort. Today pools/hot tubs are closed. According to front desk,  rain causes the pool deck to be slippery?!  Oh and the Back Bay Bistro restaurant is permanently shut down. The little walk up snack bar is only open on Sat/Sunday. No water rentals either👎👎 Guess it’s worth the drive to go elsewhere.

Website is awesome. Staff is fantastic. Wi-Fi sucks in our current location. We have reached out to the office for some help and was told that there is nothing they can do. Ok, that’s fine so we go to pay for a cabana at the pool and are told that it’s off-season, cabanas are first come first serve. Great! We go sit down to have an attendant approach us and tell our family we have to get our or security will be called! Huh? We asked, offered to pay and then get treated like junk? It wasn’t a big deal there was spots to sit by the pool, given what we paid to stay here I would expect at least some help with the Wi-Fi and to be treated like a human at the pool.  We are here for another day. Let’s see if it gets better.
Room tip: If you’re an RV traveler make sure you have Wi-Fi sorted. No promises on what’s out there onsite

Summary: Great location with plenty of amenities.  For what we paid I would have expected level sites. As narrow as the streets are it is difficult to be pulling your rig in and out of your site to try to get it level.  The rules they threaten adverse action to are more guidelines. So a few units that were over the 40-ft maximum which didn't bother me. It was the hippie bus that pulled in next to me that looked like it rolled in instead of drove in that had me concerned. Bungalows are nice!  Had a great time! We'll be back!
Room tip: Dirt lots, not concrete. Sites aren't level.

Summary: Great place to kayak and paddle board. Also has plenty of places to swim - they have large inflatable water slides sitting out in the bay. The beach is a beautiful place to walk. There are several bathroom and shower facilities as well as covered patio and seating areas and boat launches.

This place is filthy, systems not maintained, rules not enforced, noisy and overpriced. Shirt of its location there is no reason to go here! We supposedly had one of their largest sites for our rig and it hung out in the street and the front of it was jammed against the front fence staring into the neighbors yard! Sewer didn’t work nor did cable or Wi-Fi! Oh and did I mention all for nearly $200 per night? Don’t waste your time or money!

Don't waste your money! We were so excited to stay here we took our kids and some friends of ours took their kids. Camping is definitely not a new thing for us whether it be in a trailer or a tent, this time we stayed in a tent. My first problem was that we rented a fire pit and when it was picked up there was a few cans from when our kids picked up the campsite, while we were at the water the staff came to pick up the fire pit. When we got back to our campsite everything was covered in ash including the infants toys. I went to the office to inquire and the worker said straight to my face that yes he dump ash over everything bc he was mad. So instead of just waiting or possibly fining is they ruin our stuff. We were comped 3 paddle board sessions which the manager sherrie

Summary Heading: Very disappointed with the sites at this resort
Summary: Planned 2 stay from Monday to Thursday. We decided to add Sunday to our trip. We got here checked in and went to our space. Backed the 5th wheel in to our 40' space and driver side of the trailer stuck out 5' from the end of the space. Called them...there response was "That is all we have..we will send security out to see if that is ok. If it isn't you will have to leave." OKAY I spent almost $1000.00 to be here.  They called me back and said to checkout this other site.( for that I am grateful) But  they expected me to just drag this 40" trailer thru the park to see if we fit. OKAY. We attempt to get the trailer in the new spot. NOT one person parked on the street would move their vehicle to help us get into the spot. (If everyone had their vehicles in their spot there would be

Supposedly for essential travelers with all the amenities stripped from the resort this place was hugely overpriced. Have no idea why anything was closed because social distancing was laughable and those that were here are on vacation definitely not essential workers. For the over inflated price and lure of activities that were never to be realized I could have gotten an awesome small estate beachfront. Pool and sauna aren’t open and you can’t sit in the beach you have to be running into the water. The little store does not open till ten which means that you won’t be getting any coffee or breakfast supplies. The sites are cramped and there is absolutely nothing to do but play cornhole. This place might be awesome when it’s all open and worth the grotesque amount of money charged

We've stayed at the Newport Dunes 4 times because of its location.  It's very well-maintained and has excellent security.  The bathrooms/showers are clean, although the showers could use some maintenance, particularly the wheel chair accessible shower.   This RV resort is expensive because of its location.  We spent nearly two weeks at the resort during our last visit.  At that time, the pool was under renovation.  The laundry is well-maintained and tidy.  Within walking distance is Back Bay Bistro.    Also, within walking distance is the Hyatt Regency.  I mention this because there is a small Hertz Rental Car office if you want to rent a car.  We have a 22' Class B RV (Mercedes Sprinter Van) and our preference is to hook up the RV to power and water and leave it parked.

We were in town for a memorial and stayed here for 6 days. We had site 3115 which had a nice view of the bay and plenty of grass for the dog. The store is small but  has enough to get you by. There is a shopping center down the street and plant of grocery stores and restaurants close by. I gave it a 4 and not 5 because the dog run is just a small bit of dirt and the price for the park is very high.

We decided to stop at Newport Dunes RV Park on our way down the coast to be near Balboa Island & Newport Beach. Unfortunately, our spot (while over $100 for the night) was right next to the freeway and under the flight path for John Wayne Airport. 7 am and jets were taking off right over us every minute. 😬😳 The site was small and the wifi didn’t work. There seemed to be a lot of people living there too. We did, however, like the location so I guess that’s what we paid for. It’s a 5-10 minute bike ride up a steep hill and down to Balboa but once there, it’s all flat. We were able to ride our beach cruisers along the beach all the way through Newport Beach to Huntington Beach and back. 15 miles felt like 3.

Went down to the Newport dunes resort last minute for a family  camping trip.  Had a great time.  The pool was just redone and they spared no expense.  The kids play ground  was very clean. Every morning they rake the sand and clean up.  I was very impressed by their staff and sites. Will be returning during the summer to enjoy the beach!

We stayed here about 10 years ago, it was wonderful . Doesn’t look as if anything has changed for the better since. Cottage is very run down. Website states luxury and I believe renovated or updated in some capacity . This unit didn’t get the memo. Unfortunately these cottages are very neglected and very minimally stocked despite being stated us fully contained by management. The list of things wrong with our cottage is significant with some of the things being a leaking from the top slider door in the rain that locks occasionally, a ripped screen, a broken window that won’t stay open, No lightbulbs in the bedroom lamp, nothing to hang the towels on in the bathroom, cracked, old and warped floors, beat up woodwork, chipped sink and countertops , dirty refrigerator, God knows

Located in Newport Beach, Calif . The Park is  on a portion of Newport Bay and approx one mile to the Ocean. Newport Beach has numerous Restaurants and other attractions. Want a great walk? Balboa Island is less than one half mile away where you can walk the perimeter approx 2 miles of the Island. The Park is older and needs updating. Sites are small, no pull thru's very little lawn and mostly Dirt parking.Caution when making reservations rates are about as high as you will find anywhere.

I return to the Dunes after living there over 25 years ago. Many improvements easy to register and quite relaxing. Quality shows in image portrayed by Advertising and really felt they produced what they were selling. It’s a relaxing beach front area that again brought back great memories from when I lived here.

Our cottage was very comfy and had plenty of room including a full kitchen, dining room, and living room.  The kids slept in the loft and had plenty of room.  The bedroom is nice and living room has a fold out sofa so technically it sleeps six.

We stayed at a Studio Cottage #1304 very cute, great location next to security! The tv needed a new cord (fixed). I noticed the AC filter needed cleaning no biggee! Bathroom fan needed cleaning too. I brought a memory foam topper for the sofa bed worked great. A mini blind blade was missing in the middle, just hung a shirt over it. Nice little patio to sit outside it was great! At 7:00 am I hear a loud noise holy cow? dump truck nooooooooooooo it's the jets flying by (every 5 min) that's your alarm clock lol The park is great to stay, I will be back next year for the rally for sure!

Nice time at Newport Dunes. The water obstacles have been expanded and the sting ray population has decreased. Busy weekend with several parties.  Disappointed the grass under the trees are no longer available to all so we don’t go to the waterfront to sit anymore.  There is no shade. If we weren’t going with a group of friends we would scratch Newport Dunes off our list and head down the coast a bit. Note- Water was off for several hours due to a pipe breaking- lesson learned put some water in your tank just in case- this is the second time it has happened. Also the sewer backed up in our row. And we have had power outages before. The electrical pedestal only the 50 amp worked so we couldn’t plug in an extension cord.

Summary Heading: Beautiful RV park setting, but a little crowded
Summary: We've stayed here before because of its great location and nice views.  The waterfront spaces are especially nice.  It can get pretty crowded, though, especially with everyone's cars/trucks squeezing into spaces along with their RV's.  Their waste dumps in the RV spaces are set too high for easy use... that's a real design problem!  And, even though there are quiet hours set for nighttime, it's W-A-Y too noisy on weekends during the day with everyone's music blaring.  We don't understand why so many folks want their music turned up so loudly when they're parked so close to their neighbors.

Spent a nice long wonderful day with family. Has access to boats and water toys. BBQ pits and cabanas for rent. RV spots available for Camping. Hotel access too. Kid friendly. Perfect weekend get awY or family vacations

We booked a small cottage for one night because we were attending an event at the resort. Before we got there I was a little put off by their website because they don't have an option to simply show what's available on a given date and the fee.  Instead you have to click on each site for the explanation and the price, so it's a bit clunky. I also missed the small print where it said you have to provide your own linens for the small cottages, but when I emailed they were very responsive.  With that said, I was all set to be disappointed, but when we got there we were pleasantly surprised! The resort is very nice.  We were greeted warmly when we arrived and our cottage was ready. Don't get me wrong, this is not a 4 star hotel, the cottage is rustic but it was clean and served it's

Family had 2 cottages and a RV spot.  This review focuses mostly on the cottages.  But to the other items first:  Location - for those not familiar with the area.  This RV park is NOT on the beach per say.  It's a bay set back from the ocean.  So there is no ocean waves, etc here.  Not good or bad, but just need to be aware if you are wanting to be on the beach, with waves, etc.  Location part 2 - this location sits right under the flight path for John Wayne Airport.  So at 7 am sharp until around 11 pm you will hear flights taking off right over you.  Cottages -  overall the cottages are a big disappointment.  Ours is looking a bit worn out.  The beds (bedroom and sofa bed) are very uncomfortable, to the point of not being able to sleep through the night without waking up with

I didn’t know anything about Newport Dunes, but we had a couple friends planning to be here for the 4th of July holiday and decided to see if we could get a site last minute. We lucked out! A small space was available. We originally were going to tent camp, but my in-laws weren’t using their trailer, so we lucked out again!   It wouldn’t have been terrible tent camping, several people were doing it, but it was nice to have the extra sound and light insulation of a trailer. The place is packed for 4th of July and an awesome place for families.   The amenities were great. The kids loved the pool and spa, the bay, the water sports, and the water obstacle course. The market is well stocked (they even have Nothing Bundt Cakes!). The bathrooms in the “deluxe” section were clean and

Went to see a Reggae Concert here.  It was a fantastic Venue and right on the water.  They do a lot of great music venues here.  Service was great and enjoyed myself with everyone who attended.  Beautiful Sunny day with great music, Cocktails and food.  I highly recommend this experience.

For the nightly price you’d expect to get a break on the water toys rental and water park price, but everything here is pricey. Facilities are clean and adequate and there are lots of things for families and kids to do. Could be a fun weekend getaway if you have plenty of cash on hand. Not so good as just an overnight stop.

This is a fun place to visit but pricey. Close to shopping and restaurants. It is city type camping-close to your neighbors and great if you go as a group.  There is a great walking sidewalk around the back bay and a beach area to hang out. There are water activities but beware-the sting rays are dangerous. Our daughter-in-law had her leg ripped open by one requiring 18 stitches. So we stay out of the water except to kayak.  It used to be nicer for our dogs- The resort has taken away the pet areas and put a tiny joke of a pet spot way in the back that is way too small. They used to have a large area in the sand for the dogs where they could run but they took that out. They even took away the grassy areas with the shade trees where we liked to sit - Now only the high cost front

Summary Heading: Nice Place to Camp in Newport Beach.
Summary: This RV resort is very well located in Newport Beach and you pay accordingly. It is well located with a beach on an inlet off the pacific. Spaces are a good size and services are fine. As with most RB places they advertise wifi however it is generally poor and intermittent. It was close to bike paths and easy access to Balboa Island. For an urban campsite it was pretty good and didn’t have any competition in the area that I could find.

We could not have chosen a better place to spend our spring break  My kiddos love the beach and want to spend as much time there as possible which is nice because you are so close to Huntington Beach Laguna Beach and many more we visited  We chose a back in spot because we didn’t catch on to the fact they have pull in spots so your Rv can face the bay ughhh! Should have paid more attention when booking! We extended our trip 2 more nights and grabbed a pull in spot WHAT A HUGE DIFFERENCE THAT MADE! We left the front window shades up and had a great view  We went out and played in the sand at night and collected sea shells  There is a small park for the kiddos with a play set with slides and some swings  This place is super pet friendly and there is security all around all the

Newport Dunes is a nice park. It's clean and convenient to Balboa Island. The spaces are a bit tight so outdoor living area is narrow. The beach on the lagoon is nice and there are alot of walkways to take your dog for excersize. The downside is the noise. You are directley under the departure route for John Wayne airport and promptly at 7am the airplanes start. It feels like they are right over your roof. We were there a week, and like taxi's and sirens in New York...after awhile you start to get used to it!

Great location, and very family friendly!  We usually travel to the Dunes around the Christmas/New Years holiday (3rd year) for a little over a month to visit family/friends and always have a great time. An issue for us: The rules state that “No aggressive breeds” allowed, unfortunately, they do not enforce these rules. A very unfortunate incident involving a Pit Bull and a young girl (paramedics and police were involved) could have been prevented. As we are still here for a few weeks, we have seen several Pit Bull mixes, Rottweilers etc. hopefully this gets better enforced!!  Space is tight during holidays and parking is limited!

We camped at Newport Dunes in Mid October to attend a wedding that was going to take place on the beach of the lagoon. Our friends suggested that we join them camping and make it a longer weekend. It was our first trip to Newport Dunes and we really enjoyed our selves. We opted to get a premium beach front site and it was decent size, the hook ups worked with no issues and we had a really nice grass area with a white picket fence over looking the lagoon as part of our camp site. Some of the spots that were not premium were really small so if you have a larger RV, you probably won't fit very well in one of those spots.  There was a really well equipped camp store that had fresh morning coffee and some hot snacks if you so desired. There were lots of water rentals that you could

We had tickets to the Newport Dune Octoberfest (wouldn't recommend) so decided to spend the night at one of the cottages at the Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort.  It was very nice.  Easy walk to the pool, the beach and store.  Even though we were only there for one night, it was a great experience.  Would definitely recommend and would go back again.

If you're looking for an RV park that feels rustic and secluded, this is not the spot for you. If you're looking for a spot that has good amenities (think pool, etc), and don't mind being up close and personal with your neighbors, then you'll enjoy this spot. This was our first stop on an Southern California RV trip and it was a good way for us to ease into RV living. Full hookups, very clean and views of the bay. We stayed Easter weekend, and clearly a lot of people had the same idea and liked to stay up late and chat, etc - so be prepared for a social, busy spot.

This amazing resort has so much to do... If you have 4 or less in your group or family then I highly suggest renting the pedal boats and cruising over to the middle of the lake for some fun on the water slides. You and Your kiddos will love this and its a perfect opportunity to soak in the sun.

Summary Heading: My family's vacation to Newport Dunes Resort and Marina
Summary: While booking my family’s trip to Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort and Marina, I  must admit, I had my reservations. Although I have been an avid camper all my life, I had little experience beach camping, especially when it came to beach camping at a resort style campground mainly centered around RVs. My wife and I had a couple of friends who had made reservations well in advance, which I would recommend if you wish to vacation here, and offered to let us use one of the two sites that they had booked. Taking into consideration the pleasant experience my family and I had, combined with the fact that it is only a four-hour drive to Newport, CA from Las Vegas, I would recommend it for anyone who enjoys camping and/or “glamping.” 	Upon arrival to Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort and

Summary Heading: Great place for families and making memories!!
Summary: This was our fourth year to celebrate the 4th of July at Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort.   This place has it all!!  You can tent camp, hook up your RV or rent a cute bungalow.  They have showers( clean but the water was a bit cold ), swimming pool, game room where the kids played ping pong and air hockey, beach on the bay with blowup obstacle course and you can rent paddle boards, peddle boats, and bikes.   There is a cute little general store and restaurant, Back Bay Bistro which is right next to the boat launch. The security crew is awesome, shout out to the guy from Tennessee, he is so kind and patient... they all were great.  There are lots of activities for kids and grown ups plus quite possibly the best 4th of July fireworks show around!!   Highly recommend this place!!

We have been coming here for years and have ignored the price increase because it is convenient for a quick staycation. This, current trip, might be our last though. The woman at the front desk was so rude and made me feel like I was hassling her and not "good enough" for Newport dunes. It was just a crappy way to start the day. Then the site was no where near level, something you would expect from a parking lot style park. Then the pool guy hassled us because we weren't on his list. Finally, they used to let you have one RV and one car per spot. They refused to give us an extra car tag and charged my husband for having dinner with us. Just bad customer service all around.
Manager Response: We are so sorry you experienced a rude front desk attendant. We have been working hard at training our staff to treat each and every guest with the utmost respect.  Sorry about the parking as it is very tight here. We hope you'll give us another try.

Summary: We met up with family here for a short spring break getaway.  Half of us had a beachfront cottage while the other half were in the RV Park. For the price, location, and clientele they are known to serve, I had higher expectations. Regarding the RV Park, they really pack you in. The space in between each other are extremely narrow, especially if you have a larger trailer. At peak time, it gets very noisy.       I have more to say about the cottages because that’s where we stayed. The price is not cheap by any means, and it practically doubles on the weekend, even during the off-season. Here were some of the issues that we found: -broken thermostat -only one extra set of linen -broken freezer -dripping shower faucet -burned out porch light -no linen or bedding for loft area The
Manager Response: Hello, Thank You for your review. Please call me to talk about your review. I'm off on Monday and Tuesday 949 999 3103 Thank you

Summary: We stayed here with our friends in their 5th wheel. We could not believe this place! Sites are stupid close - you are practically reaching out your kitchen window to shake hands with your neighbor in theirs. Absolutely no room for parking. Kids and adults were playing bean bag toss/cornhole in the street. That was also the only area to have your bonfire - in the street. You are DIRECTLY under the jet flight path to Orange County Airport. But hey that’s ok! The jets drown out the traffic noise on the hill running the upper perimeter of this place. If people think this is camping or getting away from it all....well I’ve got a bridge to sell ya!
Manager Response: Hello, I'm sorry for your experience. Our Maintenance team went in all of our cottages to make sure everything is  working order..   Please call me if you would like to try us again. My office phone number is 949 999 3103. I will make sure you have great stay. Rick Vara

Summary: Checked into rental cottage and found many things lacking when we arrived. Booked on line. And there were 5 adults staying in the cottage.  Missing on our arrival were a sleeping mat for the LOFT, and limited kitchen supplies. The management was very helpful with solving the missing frying pan, extra towels, and credited us 1 night. Since we live on east coast and visit west coast,. we won't .likely return. But they tried to help with extra  blankets and sheets for loft. Sean in the office was helpful   There w

Called and asked specifically if I went the week before I could stay in the same spot since it was a lot of work to set up. They said no problem. Got there set up stayed for Christmas weekend then I had to return to work and left my wife and son. Thursday comes and there harassing my wife about moving. She calls me. I tell her don't worry they said we could stay in the same spot. Friday comes and she says there still harassing her. I call the office. After speaking to several people I get the manager. He tells me that if I am not moved by noon he will tow us. This is 10:30 in the morning and I am 4 hour drive away. I could not believe it. I

Summary Heading: Great water access, spacious spots, easy access to area
Summary: We recently attended a weekend vintage trailer rally.  The park was great, lots to do for all ages.  Employees were friendly.  Grounds and restrooms well kept.  Restaurant, boat launch, kayak rentals, more on site.  Highly recommend, pricey because it's in a upper end area.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort. We hope to see you again soon!  Rick Vara Director Of RV Operations  Sean Allen Front Office Manager

Summary: No happy with response My beloved dog disappeared from NEWPORT BEACH ca at Newport DUNES campground.  Please be aware there are coyotes all over the area an in the park. Protect small children an your pets. There are many cats and dogs that have gone missing. If you do happen to find my dog i have a $1000.OO REWARD for you.  THE OFFICE NEEDS TO POST SIGNS TO WARN VISITORS!!!

Summary: There were too many children the inflatables. My son got bullied on the inflatables when these teenagers sucker punched him in the face and landed on his back in the water. Lifeguard was a jerk. The security had little solution to rectifying . The parents of the bully were drinking all night. Illegal fireworks. Had to walk a long distance to the bathroom from our campsite. It's a shame that what should be a place for family fun recreation turned into a weekend of disappointment due to the lack of of appropriate lifeguard and security supervision and attention to safety first.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Sorry it took a long time to reach out to you. Please call me at 949-999-3103 to try us again.  Rick Vara Director Of RV Operations  Sean Allen Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: #BEAUTIFUL #FUN, Luxury RV Camping; Nicely kept grounds
Summary: What a wonderful surprise was that?? We canceled our reservations for the cottages because of bad reviews and just bad timing and REGRETTED that decision once we came for the day visit. We ABSOLUTELY loved the grounds and the staff. We were treated like welcomed guests even though we were day thrill seekers. The kids had fun on the water park and we saw little fishies jumping out of the water.  CONS: The mandatory life vests were way too small and caused a rash on all the kids. The water park was pricey @ $25 each/ 2 hr usage.  Can't grill out there unless you pay an $18/per person fee. OTHERWISE, LOVED IT. We will be returning soon!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort. We hope to see you again soon!  Rick Vara Director Of RV Operations  Sean Allen Front Office Manager

Summary: this was our first time visiting Newport Beach Dunes Resort. It's beautiful and accommodating for any size trailer very site is same size 40L×25w except the beachfront site. Yes they kind of are packed in like sardines but it's worth it it's so much fun. They also have little Cottages to rent if you don't have a motor home or trailer you can also just use the beach for the day. They have many things to do at a price, such as paddle boarding kayaking inflatable water park and bike rentals. They have hot showers, bathroom, laundry room, Clubhouse, Market and swimming pool on site.. they also have family movie night Friday and Saturday nights on the beach. Every site has hookups such as sewer water and electricity some have concrete slabs some don't they all have picnic tables.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort. We hope to see you again soon!  Rick Vara Director Of RV Operations  Sean Allen Front Office Manager

Summary: Arrived for day use at 10:30am weekday. Men's bathroom handicap stall disgusting. At 1:30pm still filthy. Looked like it was not cleaned in days. Store has what you need but way overpriced. It was like being in fashion island. Rv spots and everything is on top of each other. Trash cans full.  You would have to pay me to stay here. Every thing is a charge.  Handicap day use had utility cart blocking pathway both on arriving and departing. Had to use entrance road to get to quests we were visiting. It was just dirty.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Sorry it took a long time to reach out to you. Please call me at 949-999-3103 to try us again.  Rick Vara Director Of RV Operations  Sean Allen Front Office Manager

Summary: This is a valid review of the Dunes, as I lived there for over 6-Months. In regards to the park itself. It is very large and my understanding it is the only true RV park within 30 miles. It is decent for the area and close to everything you need in Orange County. There are many, many slots. The ones up front are mostly short term, weekly spots. This area is where you will hear noise, music, people streaming into the streets and crowded. People will actually put their chairs in the center of the street. Mostly on the weekends. when you go to the back is where you have the long term, full time RV'rs. It is very quiet for the most part. If you are here long term, stay in the first two lanes (streets) closest to the water.  Most all the slots are the same size, depending on which
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort. We hope to see you again soon!  Rick Vara Director Of RV Operations  Sean Allen Front Office Manager

Summary: My husband and I, who are both healthy seniors, stayed in a "cottage" at the Newport Dunes RV resort with my sister and her husband. The Dunes is a very nice, very expensive, resort in an ideal location when staying in the beautiful area of Newport Beach. It was fine for the most part, and suited our needs, except for the grossly inadequate, painfully uncomfortable sleeper sofa in the cottage. The unit is advertised as being able to accommodate 4 adults with a queen bed in the bedroom, and a sleeper sofa. The mattress on this sleeper was barely more than a sheet covering hard, poking, torturous, uneven springs. I ended up taking the bottom cushions from the sofa and lining them along on the top of the mattress to provide some protection against the springs, creating an awkward

Summary: We had a great time! The parking was easy, we brought our grill and had a beach picnic.  The cabana we rented provided shade then we rented a and paddle board, brought kayaks and enjoyed the protection of the bay.   The store provided any thing you might have forgot and really good soft serve ice cream

Summary: The first time I drove through the campsites, I thought who in their right mind would want to be 'Camping' in a 25' by 40' site in the middle of Newport Beach.  The campsites have 50 amp service, water and sewage, i.e. the basics.  This was not what I had grown up with, Park the RV, setup the E-Z up, Chairs, table, Unload the Bikes Scooters, Unicycle, and spread out, and experience nature from your camp site.  The Dunes gives you a base-camp to experience Newport Beach, with all its' shopping, restaurants, Balboa Island, Ride your bicycle, take a walk, grab your beach chair and relax on the sand overlooking the Lagoon, participate in the Dunes sponsored crafts, you are not as much camping as you are emersing yourself in the beach culture which is Newport Beach, Orange County CA.

If you are looking for an excellent family getaway look no further than Newport Dunes!!  You are surrounded by the amazing Southern California Playground.  But, there is enough to do right in the Back Bay that you don't really ever have to leave.  Very clean swimming pool!! Game room for the kids.  All kinds of water toys to rent.  The onsite store has lots of little knick knacks and whatnot.  Very quiet at night.  This is our fourth time here.  What is available for what you pay is an Incredible value!!! Many more trips to come!

The negatives: Your camping on a dirt lot. The camp spaces are very small and fenced in.  Internet and TV is ok. I would not consider this the "Ritz of Campsites".  I loved the area, but I would not camp here again..  My suggestion:  Take the fences down, add more space to the campsites, add grass and fire pits in each space.

We had prepaid and they waived that night. They were so so nice overall. Traveller tip. They have a guy making breakfast burritos in front of the general store. Don't miss out on them!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and staying with us!  Rick Vara Director RV Operations Newport Dunes Resort and Marina

Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and staying with us!  Rick Vara Director RV Operations Newport Dunes Resort and Marina

Summary: My wife and I stayed here with my grandson in October. We both felt that the park was very expensive and overated for what we got. The sites were very tight and each one was fenced with chain link fencing. I would have expected concrete or blacktop sites but instead, all they had was dirt. You're will not find a better RV place anywhere located to a beach. Good restroom facilities, ability to rent sailboats, and the security detail were attentive and made me feel safe.

Summary: Had a really good time the site was a bit small and no fire pit (unless you paid $35 per night) however good location and nice amenities made up for the site size as there was so much to do nice path around the resort for walking jogging biking ect.. movie nights on the beach were very well done,  have stayed in places where it was not so great. Will be back for sure....

Summary Heading: We had a very nice stay
Summary: We stayed on a bay front RV site the week of July 13th to the 19th .  If you can booking mid week is best as the resort has a large influx of local campers on weekends and holidays.  We had as much room as we needed with no one on either side until our departure date on Saturday.  The staff were pleasant, the site was clean, shady and fenced off from the sidewalk in front.  I know the resort has had some bad reviews so I was leery, we live only 15 miles from the resort and had last visited it almost 10 years ago.  I thought it was well run, our family had a great time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We plan many new upgrades to Newport Dunes Resort in 2015. Thank you for staying with us!  Rick Vara Director RV Operations Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort

The place is very clean and well maintained (except for the gym, the equipment is broke and old – but you’re on vacation so just go run the bay). They had a movie on the beach night that was really fun and they had different activities planned throughout the day. They do kind of nickel and dime you for everything. So bring all your entertainment and supplies with you. There is no fire pits or grill’s at the site (but you can rent it for a pretty penny). They say it’s dog friendly but no dogs allowed anywhere except walking on the path so not sure how it’s dog friendly. Overall this was a nice campground. Not my favorite

And though we had family and friends in RVs, I still wish we would have stayed at one of the great hotels just a few mins away.  They're very small. Very few people swimming. My biggest issue was the store, where everything was egregiously over priced. $8 for a small block of cheese. $2.50 for a soft serve ice cream cone. $12 for a pack of firewood and $25/night to rent a very dangerous fire pit. Plus everyone in the park smoked and started drinking at 8 am. For that, I could have just hone to Havasu.

Summary: This was my first time coming here and I was really excited. The staff was really nice and accommodating and the grounds were well kept for the most part.  We arrive Thursday night to see they didn't have any fire pits and if you wanted to rent one it was $35 a night I thought that was a little much and have never been to a place that didn't provide one with the site already. Friday our kids decided they wanted to play at the water park and again another fee of $35. They do have a lot of other free things but they do have a lot of "rental" fees for things. So I decided to shower in the resort showers because they are bigger than most trailers the
Manager Response: Thank y for your review. This weekend was not normal for Newport Dunes Resort. The county closed the lagoon due to a raw sewer spillage that occurred in Costa Mesa and was beyond our control. We had been in close communication with OC Health and Water Quality Department for updates during the closure.  The lagoon is tested daily and whenever there’s a possibility of unhealthy situations it is closed until the readings are safe for swimming.  It was reopened on Tuesday, September 3, 2013. Unfortunately, there were incidents in the pool that could have been prevented had the guest used a baby swim diaper on their baby. But they did not and we were required we close the pool to guests.  We are very aware of unacceptable water quality in the pool as well as our lagoon and we wouldn’t want anyone swimming where it isn’t safe.  Measures have been taken to procure a quicker decontamination process so our guests can enjoy the pool sooner than later.  Please go to below Heal the Bay website to review Newport Dunes Resort Heal the Bay water ratings http://brc.healthebay.org/?st=CA&f=1 I will also send you a personal email for your to contact me. Thank you

Unfortunately, we stayed at the sites without the fence and consistently had to watch people bring their dogs onto our site to poop. It is hard to enjoy a meal or the view when you have to watch the rear end of a dog and its droppings. Besides, we have 3 small children and it is not relaxing worrying about them playing in dog waste. We would stay more often if they installed fences along all the beachfront sites and I would rate them 5 star every time. In any event, we had a great time and will continue to go.

Summary: The resort is very fee driven. Off Season costs $150/night. On Season is in the $300/night. There is a fee for dogs, guest parking, etc. The nightly costs are similar to an expensive hotel, even in Southern California. For this, you would expect some basics such as a large enough pipe to support internet service. 1MB download, no upload capability. The front desk said they might upgrade their internet sometime in the next two years. By the way, there is no Ocean Beach Front, it is a bay and you must back in. I hope you have a rear window, otherwise the 'ocean front' view you pay for is to look at another RV vehicle. Summary: We thought we'd give this place another try after four years.  Looks like things haven't changed.  The staff is incredibly rude.  The noise level has only increased and Newport Dunes just can't get it right.  I thought this resort would have taken some advice from all the negative press they get, but nope, they continue to provide patrons with the same old disappointing environment.  Dumpy Dunes!

Summary Heading: Great camping destination for the non-camping type
Summary: Our family does not camp - but my sons elementary school hosted a Newport Dunes camping weekend.  All the families camped on the beach in tents.  Why is this place great for the non-camping type:   1)  Just hop in your car in the morning for a Starbucks right down the street 2)  There is a convenience store on-site with lunch, ice cream, coffee, and everythng you need for comfort  There is no doubt this is an overcrowded location - the evenings can be loud.  But if you are looking to have fun at the beach for a few days we thought this was great.  There was a playground close by. Lots of water toys that could be rented.  Even pool access for those renting a RV space - we had access because we had friends renting an RV space.  Never did find the showers - so good thing we were
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for taking the time to write a review of Newport Dunes Resort. Thank you for staying with us. We are glade you had a great experience at Newport Dunes Resort.. Thank you Rick Vara Director RV Operations

Summary: Look for your things, even watertoys were stolen. Showers are not clean, staff is not helpful. Place is very loud due to airport, next to busy highway. Sites are very small, no firepits, though you can rent them for an extra 35 fee per day(!). Never seen this elsewhere, definitely not worth the money!

Summary: Other then the nice location, these were things that will prevent us from going back:  - Small camp site. - Noise from airplanes and cars from close by freeway.  We heard the restroom door slammed all night since our site was next to the restroom. - The lagoon's water was muddy.  There were 2 "end of storm drain" signs at the beach.  Not sure if they were related. - The pool was out of control!  The hot spa posted sign "No kids under 12" but the life guards didn't bother to enforce the rule.  Some parents in the pool throwing their kids around in the pool,  I approached the life guard about this and she said that she will only stop it when someone got hurt!!!  We left because we didn't want that someone to be our kid.

Summary: We rented a cottage, which was perfect for my husband and I, along with 6 of our kids. Bigger kids slept in sleeping bags in the loft, littler kids downstairs on a sofa bed, closer to us. Cute little mini house, steps away from the beach, where the kids loved the floating playground, swimming, SUP, and boating in the bay. Pool was great too, and in the evenings we toasted marshmallows over fires in the beach fire pits. Newport is gorgeous, Balboa Island and Newport peninsula are fun with the family, and Corona del Mar is very close by for a great family beach, with Little Corona just down the street from Big Corona for fun tide pool exploring.  Staff at Newport Dunes were all very nice, we will be back next year!

Summary Heading: The Best Location, Best Staff, and Accommodations
Summary: Andy Stipe and Rick Vara - Management Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort and Marina 1131 Back Bay Drive Newport beach, Ca  92660  I have resided in 4 countries, traveled to 30, and lived in New York, Beverly Hills, Newport Beach and Greenwich, CT. I always strive to live in the best locations, and stay in the top hotels, and resorts, and will say that Newport Dunes, rates as number one in my book. Both Andy Stipe and Rick Vara were complete gentlemen, professional, and worked towards excellence from accommodations, van parking, down to package delivery – it didn’t matter, excellence was the goal and the outcome. The bottom line is that Andy and Rick and staff - made it feel like home and just have one goal – excellence in customer service. The staff is tremendously helpful,

Summary: We arive at the Newport dunes and had to wait in a long line to check in. We booked a bay front spot. We were right on the water. Nice beach with calm water. The location was very peaceful and quiet. The spot was nice with a bench. The dunes is pricy . $252 a night for bay front. But it is still worth it. The facilities were okay. Bathrooms were fine, but not the best. Pool is good, but can be overcrouded. Newport dunes is good, and I would recomend to anyone. I will stay there again.

You only have to go to Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort once, to know you will never go back. We stayed two nights, only because we got night free, and we were parked in a "DELUXE" dirt RV slot that was 25X25 with two tent cities on each side of us. Literally we had 2 feet from our trailer was our neighbor's tent on one side and the other neighbor had their picnic table butt up against us. Our trailer is only 14 feet so we are talking super close quarters.....way too close...unless you want to hear everyone's conversation day and night. Then you have the planes from John Wayne that fly directly over head from 7 am to midnight.......basically there are too many people and dogs in a one small space...won't even mention the lack of responsible dog owners who don't pick up after

Newport Beach is our favorite destination. The Newport Dunes Resort is a deluxe RV Park near the upper Newport Bay and close to many fine beaches. The resort was clean and staff were very accommodating. New to the resort is Camp James, a first class children's summer camp. Their Back Bay restaurant is a favorite with the locals. Sunday Brunch is a must!

Summary Heading: One night stay at the Newport Dunes
Summary: Got a cottage behind the cottages that was in front of the beach.  Don't think it's worth $252.00 a night.  Good thing we just stayed one night.  Don't like the idea the RV's and cottages are all together.  Made the area look crowded.  Either the clerk didn't hear what I said bout being lost & couldn't find my cottage but totally send me the wrong way.  Nice there is canoes, kayaks, peddle boats, bike rentals (but the bikes look old & creeking).  Back bay nature preservative was nice to go bike riding.  True about airplanes passing by, think I heard about 3 that passed by.  Maybe I'll go back & rent the cottage in front of the beach cause a very little bit more privacy &  very little bit more nice that it's in front of the beach or just do the camping cause it's in front of the

We just came back from a short 5 day family vacation at the Newport Dunes RV park. We cut our vacation short by one day, because we were so disappointed. The park is in a great location, clean, lovely flowers everywhere, BUT: RV spots are small without fire pits; the noise from the highway and the airplanes is loud  from very early in the morning until late at night;  Kids can not go in the water w/o  paying for a swim vest; the fun water toys were not in the water on Monday and Tuesday and the pool was also closed and many of the games in the activity room were out of order. Our kids bought tokens and could not return them. Good thing we brought the bikes to keep them busy. Renting boats, etc. was too expensive for us.

If you are looking for a great place to get your family together this is a great place. We stayed here in an RV. We had our kids and grandchildren with us.  They had a park for the kids to play.  Bike paths to ride bikes or skate board.  I would recommend the spots that oversee the water, as it allows more room for families to play games and have fun.  We witnessed an incident with someone who was camping alone and did not appreciate the noise.  Thankfully park security was sympathetic and saw that the people were having fun family time. So if you are someone that wants absolute peace and quite be aware that there are several families with chlidren that come here and this is a very family friendly park.   Very clean.

One thing I have to say is that the security is very rude an not helpful one bit. My friend got into a verbal argument with the security biker woman.  Very unsettling.  We ended up staying at the Hyatt next door on our second and final night because of her.  The bathrooms are not as clean as they should be, they seem to be cleaned only once a week or so... nasty.  There seem to be some pretty creepy people that live there year round as well. BEWARE!!   Lots of black widow spiders lurking under the picnic tables ... BEWARE  again!  The grounds are also right under the flight path of John Wayne Airport and its not a fun thing to wake up to at 6:30 a.m.  when camping.  Most definately not worth the price.

This was my first time at Newport Dunes and I thought it was fantastic!  We were going to stay one night, ended up staying two nights and then booked a spot there for a month this summer.  We stayed in a beachfront spot which was lovely. Extremely clean and well-maintained, this resort is one of the most enjoyable, beautiful and relaxing RV resorts Ive ever encountered!  I highly recommend it to everyone...including families (perfect for kids), couples (beautiful scenery, walking paths), and -mans best friend- its pet friendly too!!!!! :)

We rented a one bedroom beachfront cottage and was completely disappointed.  We paid over $200 per night and received a cottage that was worth less than $100 per night!  The cottages and facilities are not maintained well.  There is a 15 minute limit of hot water in the shower.  The window blinds are bent and broken.  There was dog poop in front of our cottage that was never picked up (even though we brought it to the front desk's attention and they said they would take care of it).  They said the movie on the beach starts at dusk, yet it didn't start for an hour after dusk.  When I called security about an issue after hours, I was not able to get through.  One of the reasons we booked at Newport Dunes was because of the beach.  However, when we got to the resort, we got a

We stayed at Newport Dunes on July 5th through the 8th of July 2011.  We were a big group and had two tent sites and one cottage.  Our tent sites were together and the cottage was 2 rows in front of us, and just a short walk.  The grounds are nicely maintained, the campsite and cabin were ready and clean for us when they said they were going to be.  I have never been camping before so this whole thing was new to me. The swimming pool was nice if you go early, but later in the day it is full of salt from the people who go back and forth between the pool and the lagoon.  The lagoon wasn't as nice as I had hoped.  It was really rocky, the water is murky and full of sludge.  Also, at night there was a big brown snake in the playground that came out of the water.  I asked the

Summary Heading: Great Location, front desk staffs need some training
Summary: Resort is in a great location, lots of activity on the beach.  Lots of water rentals available.  Expect to pay for all the activity that you want to do on the beach.  We stay in a studio cottage.  It's small but we expect it to be small since it's a studio.  As other has stated, all the site are very tight and no fire pit unless you want to rent it.  Con: Check in process was painful.  We arrive at 1:30pm, after waiting 20 minute with only 1 person ahead of me.  The clerk inform me that check in is 3pm not 2pm as their website stated.  She gave us our cabin number so we can park there but was not able to give me the key until cabin is ready.  This is reasonable, not a big deal.  As I was parking, I see housekeeping leaving the cottage.  I ask if they are done cleaning, she said

Summary Heading: What a great experience...we will go back next summer for sure.
Summary: The campgrounds were very clean, staff was friendly and we had lots to do.  We rented bikes and rode around the campground and back bay drive.  We also brought our kayak and had the best time.  My kids loved the waterpark and the pool.  I haven't been camping in years and was pleasantly surprised.  The campground is very close to Balboa Island, which is worth a trip to have lunch or dinner and shop or have an ice cream.  We will definetly go back!

The spots are small, you could ask your neighbor to hand you some toilet paper if you needed some that is how close you are.  The showers had no hot water.  The movie on the beach changed 3 times and the screen looked as though my child spilled hot coco all over it.  They ran out of life vests for the kids to play at the water park and they would not allow any child to play out there without their blue and yellow life vest.  Poor kids were waiting for hours for another kid to turn in their vest.  For the area and the price I would expect better.

We have to say that our stay at the Dunes was pretty flippin' awesome.  Everyone was so nice to us.. Starting from the time we checked in and up until the time we left.  The people at the store were just awesome.  There was a little blond girl, an older lady (who was just a total sweethart) and a nice young man.  Everyone was helpful and went out of their way to be nice.  We never got hassled by the security staff (maybe because we weren't doing anything wrong or disruptive...Just sayin'...)  There are different size camp sites for RV's of different sizes.  I wouldn't say they were too small or super hard to get into...I would say they were just right for our 33 footer.  I have to say that the pool was clean, the game room was pretty good size and the restrooms were clean too.

This is a beautiful park. We were overwhelmed by the location and how much there is to do and see. There is a paved bike/walking trail right alongside the park that goes all the way around the back bay (miles of protected land.) We spent many days bike riding to the beach, around the bay and on Balboa Island. We hardly used our van, even riding to Trader Joe's for groceries. There is a marina attached as well, where you can rent kayaks. We loved paddling out of the Back Bay through the harbour and out into the ocean where we regularly saw dolphins, seals and sea lions.   The facilities and grounds of the park are impeccably kept. The check in staff were professional and courteous, as were all staff members we encountered during our stay. We left our van door open, draining the

The location is great but not worth the hassle of the staff.  Be prepared to pay extra for everything.  Even though we had 2 hours free parking, the parking staff was so rude to us on the way out and they made us pay the full amount anyway.  We were so offended we never want to go back if that is how they treat their paying customers.

From Friday afternoon when we arrived until Monday when we packed it up, This Camp ground was one big PARTY!!! It was filled with Glamis families and friends.....So if you are looking for a family friendly party place ...look no more!!!!!

My family and I were there through easter. We had a wonderfull time. The amenities are amazing. The sites are well equiped and well maintained. The staff is incredible. That is a definite plus. They make you feel right at home. My children can't wait to go back and enjoy the movies on the beach throughout the summer. I do recommend this resort to anyone that is looking for a relaxing and beautiful vacation spot. The sites are a bit pricy but well worth it.

Summary Heading: A perfect place whether you want to be active and play or just enjoy the scenery and relax!
Summary: My family and I, which includes an infant, 10 yr old and 15 yr, all stayed at the "Dunes" and had a wonderful experience. The resort is huge and very well maintained. There is something to do for all ages, even during the winter months. My boys loved playing bingo on Saturday evening and winning a nice Newport Dunes Blanket!  I've camped at many locations, but this has to be one of the best. Where else can you camp on the water in beautiful Newport Beach? Close to Disneyland and all the major So Cal attractions. If you stay there, make sure you visit the Back Bay Bistro, which is located on the property. Awesome Sunday champagne brunch and great happy hour. You can escape the kids for a bit and walk over there for some food and beverages (on the water I might add) and not even

We stayed at the beachfront cottages at Newport Dunes Resort and were incredibly impressed. The staff went out of their way to make sure all 6 cottages were located next to each other. The rooms were comfortable, and perfectly sized for a weekend get-away with lots of children! The resort grounds were clean and well-manicured. The staff was pleasant and always eager to provide assistance. We will gladly stay here  year after year.

I've been going to Newport Dunes for over 20 years.  There is so much to do there and its beautiful and relaxing.  I live 20 minutes away and try to go there as much as I can in the summer and/or year round.  I love to rent the kayaks, go to the beach, eat brunch at their restaurant, go boating and I've rented their cottages too.  Everything is very convenient.     It's great for the whole family.  When our daughter was young we would spend many weekends at the Dunes, you can pull your car right up to the sand and unload the toys, rafts and beach gear.  There is a playground, beach, pool, snack bar, showers, fire pits, movies on the beach weekend nights, the list goes on.  You can also ride your bikes along the back bay which is beautiful.  I highly recommend visiting Newport

Summary Heading: A great place with much to offer
Summary: My wife and I have been RV'ers for more then twenty years and never found a RV park with so much to offer. Not only is the park first rate but the area offers world class shopping, entertainment, and dinning. Not to mention its located right on the water at Newport Beach's famous bay.  A great place to stay.

My wife and I had a great time for our anniversary. The staff was very polite and helpful and I could not have found a better place so close to our house.  I will definitely make plans spend another weekend there, as it met all of our expectations when it comes to cleanliness and comfort.

I was very impressed with our stay at Newport Dunes.  It was relaxing, non threatening.  It met  all of our needs. Our experience was very nice and memorable. A must do again.  Perhaps turn it into tradition. Loved it there, and the location is simply perfect!!
We found Newport Dunes to be a excelen place to spent time with family and frinds. We enjoy the fact that it has excelent activities for all ages. We look foward to go back.
Very good place to just sit looking at the scenery ...... quite ....... very good to relax....... My family loved it!
I found in  Newport Dunes Waterfront RV and Camping Park a quiet and charming place for adults, and a safe place for kids to play and have fun. I loved it!
This is our 5th year visiting the Newport Dunes Resort.  We love the location and the weather.  The employees are not only friendly, but also very helpful.
Best place to camp with families,  Clean, near fashion island and the beach.  Great place I have been camping here for years.

This is a nice Rv park for the kids. This was our first trip with our new 34 foot admiral unit. We arrived and got prompt check in. I told them it was my first time and they gave me an easy to get into corner spot. Staff was great. The spaces are small but the location fabulous. Lots to see and do. Its close to the hyatt newporter where we stayed at almost double the price per nite.  There are lot of bike trails so bring bikes. There is a great lagoon with swimming for kids and a water park that is awesome. They also have the bands on friday and saturday nite as well as movies on the beach. This is a great family spot. You want to get a front row seat for your rv as they have much more space.  The pool was great. They have a dog wash machine and great rec room. They have a few

During a transaction at one of the several equipment rental concessions provided by the resort, my credit card was stolen. If you go to the Dunes Waterfront Resort take extra care to protect yourself.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments: Here at Newport Dunes Resort  we take our customers privacy very seriously. Over the twelve years I have worked for Newport Dunes Resort, I have not had any instances of credit card fraud with our employees. This customer had unauthorized credit card charges made in local cities. We encouraged this customer to report to police.  In this case, the customer and the credit card company decided not to report to police. The customer was reimbursed by his credit card company. Our internal security investigation didn’t find any evidence of fraud. We did a company wide training about credit card fraud.  Rick Vara Director of RV Operations Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort and Marina

Summary: My wife and I are regular visitors to Newport Dunes.  We find that the staff, surroundings and activities are all top notch.  The employees are very friendly and helpful.  You can even talk with the manager, Rich Vara, by simply asking.  He is an extremely accommodating person, and we look forward to saying "hello" each time we visit.  The grounds are always clean and attractive.  We have attended many activities there and enjoy each one.  Love the new "Bands in the Sands" weekly Saturday night concert!  Great touch.  We danced all night along with other "campers".  They even had a bar on the beach.  To sum it up, don't listen to all the naysayers putting this place down.  If you want to have a great vacation in a great location, put this place on your itinerary.  You won't be

Summary Heading: STAYED TWICE IN TWO MONTHS - HAD A GREAT TIME WITH FAMILY FRIENDS
Summary: We have friends who rent a space for the summer each year. This is the first time we have taken them up on an offer to stay a few days. We stayed a day  Memorial  and stayed 4th of July weekend.  The park is very busy but I saw employees constantly cleaning areas and the bathrooms. Every employee I talked smiled  was friendly and helpful. Notably office and market, activities.  Our friends say it is quiet during the week and non holiday weekends. I rented 4 person bikes for our group and my kids loved the game room/crafts (t-shirts/crafts great!) Lot's of things to do like movie nights and music.  We plan to cool down and visit often this summer. Next time I'm going to get a cottage. This is a great place.

Wonderful resort located in Newport Beach. Great views of their lagoon.  Staff always friendly. The resort puts on great activities for their guests. Enjoyed their new "bands in the sand" concert. Resort getting ready for their 4th of July activities and very popular firework show.  Resort pricey but we booked last minute. Suggest booking early as possible as resort books up, especially on week-ends.

Summary Heading: Always the best place to be!
Summary: We've stayed at this park on and off for over 12 years including 2 months summer stays. Compared to other accommodations we've found it to be quite reasonable. Have recommended it to many others whom have enjoyed both weekend stays and day trips. 4th of July is not to be missed!

Summary Heading: We Had a Great Experience Here
Summary: We just stayed in the premiere RV area - very good space, very clean and right on the water.  At this time of the year there was absolutely no issue of water smelling as someone wrote in a review.  The restaurant was great and the staff whom we met were all very helpful.  We will definitely be going back.

Summary Heading: Was not pleased with this Park
Summary: We made a reservation for Premium spaces (#2323 & #2325) which were a nice location, close to the end of the row and directly across the street from the restrooms.  Family members had stopped by the location a month earlier and were very pleased with the cleanliness of the park and amenities.  When we arrived mid afternoon, there was only one (1) person to check-in arrivals although several other people kept walking by the counter but when asked, none could assist us.  On route to our spaces, we observed several vehicles parked in front of their units and mostly were parked either half or all the way into the street.  The space was narrow but enough for our 28' trailer with a 3' tip out.  This still allowed room for a 8' x 10' tent at the back of the space but needed to park

Summary Heading: I didn't know they have a Motel 6 in Newport Beach...
Summary: I'll give Newport Dunes credit, they sure did a fine job covering up any flaws on their website.  First of all...I took my family of four to Newport Dunes based on location (Newport Beach).  So far so good.  Unfortunately, that's where the adventure begins.  We had a "premium space" at a rate of $177/night.  What we received was a rv space which barely fit our RV of 30 feet.  Literally, I was able to reach out my window and touch the rv next to us...our slide out was not able to be fully deployed.  Without having to say much more...Newport Dunes is way too tight for larger RVs....even if you can get your RV in a space...streets are scattered with cars, golf carts, bicycles, and pedestrians...it poses a real safety hazard.  All the amenities are old and in need of replacement.

what a rip off..I called to make reservations and they quoted me a ridiculous rate for  four nights, Thursday,Friday,Saturday,Sunday and leaving Monday. I asked them why are they charging so much and that i wanted a spot in th back row and i quoted the price off their summer price list to the guy on the phone that was trying to take advantage of us and i was told that if the park is slow that they don't go by the site prices on their website that they charge more to compensate but if the park is full they give you a better deal..OMG how stupid, We decided to go to San Diego, I don't think we will ever return to Newport Dunes ever. We used to visit this park at least six to seven times a year..to bad they raised the prices so high..in the long run they lose. They charge way to
Manager Response: Dear Reviewer, thank you for taking the time to post and share your comments. Since you are not accepting correspondence, I can’t respond to you directly.    Our RV sites are priced like a Hotel. As occupancy goes up so does the rate. Many companies in hospitality business yield rates. Our rates are posted as “$$$$ and up”. You mention: “We used to visit this park at least six to seven times a year”. I don’t want this poor experience over the phone to effect all the good times you have had over the years at Newport Dunes. Please call me directly at 949-999-3103 to talk about your phone experience.  Thank you, Rick Vara Director RV Operations Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort

Summary Heading: Off to a bad start, but turned out OK. Just need more compensation for our trouble!
Summary: Our 2nd stay here, and am still feeling ripped off.   We checked in late on a Tuesday nite, and when we got to our unit, it was  TRASHED:  Beer cans, party streamers and hamburgers buns all over the floor, the door was jammed with trash, and the best part of all: the bed had a big vomit pool right in the middle!  The staff scurried around finding another available unit, and we ended up with an upgrade at the waterfront area.  Nice, but it took over an hour to get settled and my kids were sitting on the curb waiting.  We did get a better location for the same price as the original cabin, but after the inconvenience, I feel we should have been given a refund, or the very lest, a free stay for next time, if that happens!
Manager Response: We, at Newport Dunes Waterfront Resort, work hard to provide a great experience for all of our guests.  The following is the e-mail response I sent to this guest: Hello, I'm Rick Vara, Director RV Operations, Newport Dunes Resort. It is my job to make sure all our guests have a good experience. I'm sorry you did not. Did any of my staff offer any compensation for your troubles? Please contact me at 949 999 3103 and I will make sure your next stay is great. Thank you for your review, Rick Vara Director RV Operations

Summary Heading: We love this place stayed twice
Summary: The sites are smaller, it is NEWPORT BEACH it is a crowed city. We travel in a 29 ft travel trailer and find it comfortable. They do provide a table. The bathrooms are clean, the pool is nice and so is the hot tub. We stayed our first time for 6 days, the last trip was only 3 nights. Great location, your not going to get any better. The park is not on a highway, so no road noise. I have not had a problem with noise the two times I have stayed there.  Most of the people there seemed to be families with young children. Bring your bikes to ride the great bike paths. Near a lot of great restaurants, the park provides you with a great guide. With in 40 minutes of down town LA.

Summary Heading: Nice park for a weekend getaway!
Summary: This was our very first RV vacation with our new RV so I can't compare it to other RV parks.  We were told by numerous people that this was a very nice park and it was.  The swimming lagoon was great for swimming, rafting, and our kids (9,11,14) had a great time.  The sand is dusty and the area around the lagoon is muddy but the kids didn't seem to mind.  We spent half a day on Balboa Island which is about a mile or more away.  It's a nice walk and the area is beautiful.  You can bring your towels along and walk to the beach (a total of 2 miles away from the Dunes).  The downside to this park is the fact that they are located near an airport.  It wasn't too bad over the weekend but come Monday morning the airline traffic was busy!  I woke up at 7 am and the planes were passing

Summary Heading: Stayed in beachfront cottage, could have been better
Summary: We paid $150 per night.  Cottage was small which was ok but bathroom had no ventilation and back bedroom and bathroom both smelled moldy.  Kitchen had toaster oven and microwave, fridge, plates, butter knives, forks, spoons.  Pull out sofa was terribly uncomfortable as was expected.  My 4 year old was fine in the loft but my 6 year old kept bonking his head as ceilings are low.  Stairs are steep and small.    You would not want to swim in the water.  The bay is a mud pit and we all slipped several times on the mossy mud covered beach (near water).  It is rocky, not sandy.  There is some nice sand by the play structure though.  This place worked for us with our situation with the kids as we needed a play structure.  The pool was great and the path around the bay was great for

When I read the negative reviews on this rv resort I almost cancelled my reservations but we decided to give it a chance anyway.  We found the resort to be ideally located for just about any activity imaginable.  It was clean, the staff was extremely friendly and the scenery was perfect.  Most of the negative reviews I read complained about the resort not being the Luxurious RV resort that is advertised on their web and by today's standard's it does fall short of that mark.  However when Nancy and I took a short walk from our site to visit Balboa Island we discovered a tiny little bugalow vacation rental there being advertised for $5000 for a one week stay.  This surely makes Newport Dunes RV park look extremely luxurious at less than one tenth the price.  The sites are alittle

Loud party went on till 11 p.m. complete with fireworks and a stereo system that was louder than a live band. The 20 somethings smoking dope beside us was a nice touch for our son. The site itself is small, uneven and only fit our fifth wheel although it was supposed to be a deluxe site. For the $130 a night they charged, I would pass right on by this place.  There are tons of nicer parks with more for people to do.

We were a group of 10 people in two 5th wheels campers. One was 38 feet and the other was 32 feet. Pulling into the campsite was a little tight with the big rigs. We were in the second row of sites. The waterfront is a small bay- no waves, but big jellyfish in the water that terrified the children. Also if you are traveling with children bring life vests and extra money for the kyacks and paddle boats and inflatable water toys. We found nothing in the web site mentioning the need for life jackets. One more thing- listen for the airplanes take off starting near 7am from OC airport (very loud). The young kids at the front desk knew nothing of RVing and couldn't even offer simple directions around NB. Just back from a lovely weekend at the Newport Dunes RV Resort.  I was impressed by the cleanliness of the park and attention to detail of the staff.  Everyone was friendly and the place was obviously well run.  We had a tiny campsite at the back, but it was perfectly adequate (25 x 25) for our van conversion and was a very short walk from the beach.  Full hookups for RV's.  Enjoyed the walking path that circles the bay and the cafe (breakfast and lunch this time of year) was terrific.  We're already planning a trip back in the spring.

If you plan ahead and have a space on the water, this might be a better experience.  Otherwise, spaces are small and divided by bent up green fences.  Laundry facilities are inconvenient.  For as much money as they get for these spaces, I sure expected something more then just a patch of dirt to park on.

I cannot imagine anyone staying at this dump!  Perhaps if one has only experienced mediocre RV campsites then Newport Dunes is just your hangout.  I for one enjoy a good, clean RV campsite as well as friendly staff ALL YEAR long rather than during the less trafficked season.  Avoid Newport Dunes at all costs!!

We stayed here in our RV once again in early January of 2007. This RV Resort was even better during the winter months. We got lucky with 75 degree weather the weekend we stayed here. Pretty good weather for January! They keep this resort very clean. You see the staff cleaning the campsites between checkouts. They water down the cement, blow the dirt of any debris, and then rake it afterwards.  We celebrated my husband's birthday, and had a beach front pull in  premuim site. It  made such a difference from when we stayed in a smaller RV site here a few rows back from the beach last summer. I recently stayed at the Newport Dunes in one of the "Luxury Cottages" on the beach.  We paid $385 per night for a cottage that was described to sleep 6 and have a full kitchen.    I would not recommend renting these cottages unless Newport Dunes significantly lowers the price and you arrive with pretty low expectations.  Our kitchen had a microwave and toaster oven.  The website advertised a "full kitchen" and showed a kitchen that did not look anything like the one we had.  We had no cooking utencils other than a few forks, spoons and two butter knifes.  When I asked for a knife in order to slice up some fruit, I was told no.  For $385 dollars a night, I should not have to beg for cutlery. Summary Heading: security is Very rude, hastled Everyone
Summary: I went with a group of 6 families. All with kids of all ages. The staff was very nice, but the place is not near worth the price. The security guards go around hasling everyone for no reason. The activities are scarce and the lagoon is gross. The smallest campsites I ever stayed in and no parking for your tow vehicle, golf cart or bicycle anywhere. I would not recommend this place or go back. Mark it up to "Been there, done that."

This August will be our 9th year!  This is the vacation we all look forward to each year.  They are now teenagers and love the dance on Thursday... (should have the dance on a weekend night also).  The adults are able relax, make friends and enjoy the activities in the club house. The younger kids are safe, lots of activities for them too.   I would recommend Newport Dunes to adults and families alike.

Summary Heading: nice but expensive, bring earplugs, little privacy
Summary: We stayed one night in June 2003 to test out our new pop-up trailer. We liked the location in Newport Beach off Pacific Coast Hwy, Bay, Restaurant at the Marina, Beach, Walks. Didn't like public bathrooms (dirty and smelly), rv lots (close to each other and no privacy) - had to move due to cigarette smokers, late arrivals allowed after 11PM, birds in trees near beach extremely noisy (didn't sleep at all).

My family and I stayed at the Newport Dunes for a week. We stayed through the 4th of July, and had the best time. The staff was very polite and eager to help in any way. The fireworks display was the best I had every seen. The RV sites were comfortable and very clean. Unlike another review that I read, the pool was a great place to relax and our picnic table was in excellent condition. I would recommend this resort to anyone that likes to camp in style and comfort.

We have had a wonderful time at Newport Dunes this summer! We visited  friends there on the 4th. Hmmm...we didn't get there till late on the  4th and still got tickets to the water park.  We also stayed there two long weekends on July 11-13 and July 18-21.  Which by the way were sold out weekends as well!  The kids had so much fun that we have reservations also for August 8-12 and August 22-25.  We played all day at the water park, swam back and forth to the whale, kayaked the bay, rode bikes on the trail, swam in the pool, ate ice cream, played in the game room and had a ball. For sold out weekends...it didn't appear to be overcrowded...try going to Mountain Lakes Resort of Distinction in Lytle creek on a sold out weekend!    It's too bad the previous visitors had a "murphy"

Summary Heading: Great Fun Time & Great Fun Place
Summary: This was our first trip to The Dunes.  We tour the country 6-8 months of the year in our RV and we have never found a place as nice as this.  Right on the water and with lots of activities and the convenience of its restaurant and grocery store, who could ask for more.  We became great friends with some of our neighbors and will be meeting up again here soon.
